verses.verse: (For the choir director; on stringed instruments. A Psalm of David.) Answer <S%H6030><s%> me when I call, <S%H7121><s%> O God <S%H430><s%> of my righteousness! <S%H6664><s%> Thou hast relieved <S%H7337><s%> me in my distress; <S%H9496><s%> Be gracious <S%H2603><s%> to me and hear <S%H8085><s%> my prayer. <S%H8605><s%>

O sons <S%H1121><s%> of men, <S%H376><s%> how <S%H4100><s%> long <S%H5704><s%> will my honor <S%H9202><s%> become a reproach <S%H3639><s%>? [How long] will you love <S%H157><s%> what <S%H7385><s%> is worthless <S%H7385><s%> and aim <S%H1245><s%> at deception <S%H3577><s%>? Selah. <S%H5542><s%>

But know <S%H3045><s%> that the Lord <S%H3068><s%> has set <S%H6395><s%> apart <S%H6395><s%> the godly <S%H2623><s%> man <S%H2623><s%> for Himself; The Lord <S%H3068><s%> hears <S%H8085><s%> when I call <S%H7121><s%> to Him.
Tremble, <S%H7264><s%> and do not sin; <S%H2398><s%> Meditate <S%H559><s%> in your heart <S%H3824><s%> upon your bed, <S%H4904><s%> and be still. <S%H1826><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>
Offer <S%H2076><s%> the sacrifices <S%H2077><s%> of righteousness, <S%H6664><s%> And trust <S%H982><s%> in the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>

Many <S%H7227><s%> are saying, <S%H559><s%> "Who <S%H4310><s%> will show <S%H7200><s%> us [any] good <S%H9185><s%>?" Lift <S%H5375><s%> up the light <S%H216><s%> of Thy countenance <S%H6440><s%> upon us, O Lord! <S%H3068><s%>

Thou hast put <S%H5414><s%> gladness <S%H8057><s%> in my heart, <S%H3820><s%> More <S%H4480><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> when <S%H6256><s%> their grain <S%H1715><s%> and new <S%H8492><s%> wine <S%H8492><s%> abound. <S%H7231><s%>

In peace <S%H7965><s%> I will both <S%H3162><s%> lie <S%H7901><s%> down <S%H7901><s%> and sleep, <S%H3462><s%> For Thou alone, <S%H910><s%> O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> dost make me to dwell <S%H3427><s%> in safety. <S%H983><s%>
